Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= man; ◄ son of Beeri (בְּאֵרִי) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of prophet (נָבִיא) Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ)
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= man, also known as Azariah (עֲזַרְיָה) ◄ son of Amaziah (אֲמַצְיָהוּ) tribe of Judah; ► father of Jotham (יֹותָם) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) but became leprous after he burned incense in the temple
= man; ◄ son of king Azariah (עֲזַרְיָה) who is also known as Uzziah (עֻזִּיָּה) ► he succeeded his father as king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= man; ◄ son of Jotham (יֹותָם) ► king of southern kingdom of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= man, also known as Hezekiah (חִזְקִיָּהוּ) ◄ son of Ahaz (אָחָז) ► father of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= man; ◄ son of Joash (יֹואָשׁ) ► king of northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Jehoahaz (יְהֹואָחָז) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) (798 782/81)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Beeri (בְּאֵרִי) ► prophet (נָבִיא)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Beeri (בְּאֵרִי) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman, ◄ daughter of Diblaim (דִּבְלָיִם) ► wife of Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Gomer (גֹּמֶר) wife of the prophet (נָבִיא) Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ)
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= man; ◄ son of prophet (נָבִיא) Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and his wife Gomer (גֹּמֶר)
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= town and valley; ◄ territory of Issachar (יִשָּׂשכָר)
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Jehoshaphat (יְהֹושָׁפָט) son of Nimshi (נִמְשִׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) (c. 841 814)
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= town and valley; ◄ territory of Issachar (יִשָּׂשכָר)
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= woman; ◄ daughter of prophet (נָבִיא) Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and his wife Gomer (גֹּמֶר) ► whose name had a prophetic significance
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= soldier riding a horse
= to accustom an infant to food other than its mother's milk

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman; ◄ daughter of prophet (נָבִיא) Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and his wife Gomer (גֹּמֶר) ► whose name had a prophetic significance
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= man; ◄ son of prophet Hosea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and his wife Gomer (גֹּמֶר) ► whose name had a prophetic significance
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
